title: Robert King Anderson
text:
Robert King Anderson (August 29, 1861 – July 3, 1950) was a <a href="Canadian">Canadian</a> <a href="politician">politician</a>, <a href="physician">physician</a> and <a href="teacher">teacher</a>.
Biography.
Anderson graduated as a physician from the <a href="University%20of%20Toronto">University of Toronto</a> in 1888, and pursued postgraduate studies in <a href="Edinburgh">Edinburgh</a>, <a href="New%20York%20City">New York City</a> and <a href="Chicago">Chicago</a> before setting up in practice. On settling in <a href="Milton%2C%20Ontario">Milton, Ontario</a>, he pursued an interest in local politics, becoming a town councillor in 1904-1907 and Mayor in 1907–1909, as well as being Chairman of the Milton Hydro-Electric Commission for eight years. From 1906, he served in the <a href="Canadian%20Militia">Canadian Militia</a> with the <a href="The%20Lorne%20Scots%20%28Peel%2C%20Dufferin%20and%20Halton%20Regiment%29">20th Halton Rifles</a> as its <a href="major">major</a> and <a href="paymaster">paymaster</a>.
He was elected to the <a href="House%20of%20Commons%20of%20Canada">House of Commons of Canada</a> representing the <a href="Electoral%20district%20%28Canada%29">riding</a> of <a href="Halton%20%28electoral%20district%29">Halton</a> in <a href="1917%20Canadian%20federal%20election">1917</a> and re-elected in <a href="1921%20Canadian%20federal%20election">1921</a>, <a href="1925%20Canadian%20federal%20election">1925</a>, <a href="1926%20Canadian%20federal%20election">1926</a> and <a href="1930%20Canadian%20federal%20election">1930</a>.
